markdownRemark.html:
Basically I’m trying to learning something more about machine learning. This is post represents the very first of its kind and is to be considered a work-in-progress. It will be further detailed and eventually corrected while I’m getting more acquainted with the subject.

NDArray

Nth dimensional array

Jupyter book

Activation functions

ReLu

Rectified Linear Unit

Train in batches

Train and test dataset

Fully Connected Layers

Softmax

Models

Static computation graphs

  • Perceptron
  • FFNN

Dynamic computation graphs

  • RNN (Recurrent Neural Networks)
  • GANN (Generative Adversarial Neural Networks)

Frameworks

Tensorflow   (Google)

Tensorflow is to be coded in a declarative fashion. It is a perfect match for static computation graphs.

PyTorch   (Facebook)

PyTorch is to be coded in a imperative fashion. It is a perfect match for dynamic computation graphs.

MxNet   (Amazon)

MxNet share many similarities with Tensorflow. As a bonus it can run on Amazon AWS infrastructure.

SciKit-Learn

https://scikit-learn.org/stable/documentation.html
